Package grave_escape.game

Class MovingObject

java.lang.Object
grave_escape.structure.Position
grave_escape.game.MovingObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
Enemy, Player
public class MovingObject extends Position
The MovingObject class represents an object that can move on the game grid. It extends the Position class, keeping track of its position and direction of movement. The object also tracks whether its movement matches the previous move direction.

      protected Direction facing
      Stores the Direction in which the Object will be facing

  • Constructor Details

    • MovingObject

      public MovingObject(Position position)
      Constructs a MovingObject with the specified initial position. The initial direction is set to Direction.LEFT.
      Parameters:
      position - the initial position of the object on the grid.

  • Method Details

    • getPosition

      public Position getPosition()
      Gets the current position of the moving object.
      Returns:
      the current position of the object as a Position.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(Position p)
      Sets the position of the moving object and updates its direction based on the movement. The object's facing direction is adjusted based on the relative movement direction. If the direction of movement is the same as the previous movement, the matchPrevMove counter is incremented, otherwise, it is decremented.
      Parameters:
      p - the new position to set for the object.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Gets the current x-coordinate of the moving object.
      Overrides:
      getX in class Position
      Returns:
      the x-coordinate of the object.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Gets the current y-coordinate of the moving object.
      Overrides:
      getY in class Position
      Returns:
      the y-coordinate of the object.

    • getFacing

      public Direction getFacing()
      Gets the direction the object is currently facing.
      Returns:
      the Direction the object is facing.

    • isMatchPrevMove

      public int isMatchPrevMove()
      Gets the number of consecutive moves in the same direction.
      Returns:
      the number of moves that match the previous direction.
